intro: Hieracium duplex, commonly known as the double devil's bit manna, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. The plant features yellowish-green to reddish leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It is characterized by its distinctive two-layered inflorescence, which gives it its common name. Hieracium duplex is typically herbaceous and can be either annual or perennial depending on the climate.
